responsibilities: Responsible for the definition, configuration, and development of core laboratory/hospital software solutions for designs of intermediate and moderate complexity.
Develops use cases, requirements, and specifications for new and existing system designs.
Evaluates and defines product changes with TPM to resolve customer issues and provide input on new functionality for moderate complexity projects.
Leads technical discussions with TPM and builds and maintains relationships.
Participates in investigations to determine root cause for moderately complex issues that may cross multiple products.

Performs software installation and configuration, tests laboratory workflows, creates and maintains business rules, verifies system and instrument interfaces, and generates input to service personnel.
Provides and gathers inputs from internal and external sources and from members of the project’s cross-functional team to achieve customer needs.
Reviews technical risks and takes appropriate action. Reviews and provides input into risk management documentation, including FMEA and risk analyses.
Follows functional area policies and procedures.
Trains and mentors associate systems analysts in tools and processes.
Receives general direction and completes moderately complex assignments.
Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals.
Implements activities for projects and may participate in the hiring process for technical resources, providing feedback to the hiring manager.
Provides input on project activities and may assign activities to other team members.
qualifications: Ability to lead technical discussions and build relationships with TPM.
Experience in performing investigations and resolving customer issues.
Knowledge of risk management practices and adherence to quality systems.
Ability to mentor and train junior team members.
analysis: The job responsibilities and skills listed do not explicitly mention Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs). The responsibilities focus on software solutions for laboratory/hospital settings, developing use cases, requirements, and specifications, evaluating product changes, leading technical discussions, and performing software installation and configuration. The skills required include analytical and problem-solving skills, technical leadership, risk management, and communication skills. There is no indication of working with AI models, natural language processing, or any tasks related to GenAI or LLMs. The job seems to be more focused on software development and system analysis in a healthcare context rather than AI or language model development or application.
